structure.unit: LICENSING OF MOTOR VEHICLES, OPERATORS, AND TRAILERS

law.catch_line: Application for operator's license by military enlistee -- Conditions.

text.section:
Notwithstanding KRS 186.450, 186.452, and 186.454, a person who is under eighteen (18) years of age may apply for an operator's license if the person has:
Held an instruction permit for a minimum of one hundred eighty (180) days; and
Enlisted in the United States Armed Forces or a state National Guard.
An individual eligible to apply for an operator's license under this section shall present proof of enlistment at the time of application.

law.history: Created 2009 Ky. Acts ch. 46, sec. 1, effective June 25, 2009.
